Title: The anamorph of Chaenothecopsis debilis.
Keywords:
anamorphs; cladistic analysis; Chaenothecopsis;
Chaenothecopsis debilis; systematics
Abstract:
The anamorph of Chaenothecopsis debilis is coelomycetous.
The wall of the conidiomata consists of several layers. The conidia are
nonpigmented, sickle-shaped and formed from conidiogenous cells forming
part of the conidioma wall. This anamorph is compared to anamorphs of
other Chaenothecopsis species. In a cladistic analysis the distribution
of different type of anamorphs in Chaenothecopsis are mapped.
Hyphomycetous anamorphs from cultures are reported for the first time in
Chaenothecopsis pusilla, C. pusiola and C. tasmanica.
